title: Sans-serif all caps with low x-height
content:
Sorry if I'm not using the right terminology with "x-height." As you can see, the horizontal lines in the capital letters are quite low. Not sure what you call that. I'd appreciate your help in ID'ing this font! I work for author Kate Carlisle and am designing some promo items.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [high-end-finish.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110155749/http:/typophile.com/files/high-end-finish.jpg) | 11.64 KB |
author: Jenel

comments.content: It must be **[Bernhard Fashion](http://web.archive.org/web/20141110155749/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Monotype&ffam=Bernhard%20Fashion%20Std%20-%20Regular&fid=deda56f043fc761e801328978dbd074e&fsize=60&text=KATE%20CARLISLE&fit=1)** by Lucian Bernhard [1929] available from Bitstream, Monotype, Linotype, Tilde, URW++, E&F, etc
